title: Gradient Descent / Parameter Optimization Audit
verdict: PASS - No standalone gradient descent algorithm; BayesianOptimizer provides sample-efficient alternative

gradient_descent_search.referenced_in: AlgorithmGatewayEngine.ts (line 59) as a named concept for MIT 6.079 course mapping
gradient_descent_search.reason_not_standalone: Manufacturing optimization problems rarely have analytical gradients; metaheuristic and Bayesian approaches are preferred

bayesian_optimizer_audit.theory: Gaussian Process surrogate with acquisition functions (EGO)
bayesian_optimizer_audit.reference: Jones et al. (1998); Snoek et al. (2012)
bayesian_optimizer_audit.length_scale: Auto from median pairwise distance or manual
bayesian_optimizer_audit.matrix_inverse: Gauss-Jordan with partial pivoting (adequate for small n)
bayesian_optimizer_audit.limitation: O(n^3) matrix inverse limits to ~100 observations (appropriate for expensive mfg experiments)

other_optimization_algorithms.coverage: Comprehensive optimization toolkit without need for standalone gradient descent
